bullets: Attended Metas Engineering bootcamp where I worked on small tasks for various Meta products such as Facebook & Oculus to try different tech stacks and explore different opportunities within Meta.
Contributed to Instagrams Design System creating components for their iOS, Android, and Web platforms using React, native development frameworks, and cross platform mobile frameworks

Contributed to a Ruby on Rails application that allows content creators to create their own subscription-based streaming service similar to Netflix or Hulu (marthastewart.tv, criterionchannel.com, and dropout.tv)
Lead several major projects that improved both seller and buyer satisfaction
Mentored an intern and new engineers on the team to set them up for success on the team and their careers
Supported in-app purchases with the Google Play Store, Roku store, and the Apple App Store
Worked with legacy versions of Rails and supporting gems, and upgraded the repository towards modern versions of Rails
Migrated several web pages from legacy ERB templates to React, which allowed the team to use newer libraries and other internal Vimeo tools
Contributed to a web application as a full-stack engineer using a Ruby on Rails backend, and HAML & React frontend
Maintained 100% backend code coverage with rspec and 100% frontend code coverage with jest.
Met with Business Analysts, Test Engineers, and a Lead Software Engineer to plan new features before beginning engineering work
Worked closely with test engineers to investigate and fix bugs on the application
Assisted the customer service team with customer issue investigations and manual data changes if necessary.
